title: Slope
text: Find the slope by counting the rise and run. The slope is calculated like this: $$\frac{y2-y1}{x2-x1}$$ where x1 and y1 are the values of one and x2 and y2 are the valus of the second point.
speech: Find the slope by counting the rise and run. The slope is calculated like this:  fraction, y 2 minus y 1, over, x 2 minus x 1,   where x1 and y1 are the values of one and x2 and y2 are the valus of the second point.
pacedSpeech: Find the slope by counting the rise and run. The slope is calculated like this:   fraction, y 2 minus y 1, over, x 2 minus x 1,
where x1 and y1 are the values of one and x2 and y2 are the valus of the second point.

title: Slope Value
text: The slope of the line is $$-1$$. Elimate multiple choice options without this slope.
speech: The slope of the line is  minus 1 . Elimate multiple choice options without this slope.

. Elimate multiple choice options without this slope.

title: Choose one point

title: Substitute
text: Substitute the values into the point-slope form $$y-y1=m(x-x1)$$
